speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, what are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: This fruit-nut muffin contains a number of things I don't care for.  Currants, a husk of something... [_flicks something off_] Away, wrinkly thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, if you and Maris ever reconcile, I'm gonna miss these tranquil mornings - I reading my newspaper, you tweezing your muffin!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, boys.  I got a letter from one of my old army pals, Bud Farrell.  The whole platoon's getting together next weekend on Rattlesnake Ridge.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good for you.  Speaking of old chums, Daphne, a Clive called for you a little earlier.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_worried_] Clive?

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm-hmm.

speaker: Daphne
text: Did he sound British?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, he was one of those fiery Mexican Clives!  He said he'd call back.

speaker: Daphne
text: I bet he will!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, boy! [_sitting down:_] I can't wait to see the old gang!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Dad, you're not thinking of driving all the way to Rattlesnake Ridge?  It's five hours away, you know how your hip stiffens up.

speaker: Martin
text: No problem, they said I can bring a guest!  So, who's the lucky one?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, by my count, two of us get to be lucky!

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, they're great guys - Stinky, Wolfman, Boom-Boom, Jim.  Of course his name's not really Jim, we call him that because he likes to drink Jim Beam.  Just like we call Hank "Bud," because he drinks Budweiser.  Come on, you'd love these guys!

speaker: Niles
text: We're sherry drinkers, Dad.  Think about it!  Anyway, I have a conference that weekend.

speaker: Daphne
text: And I have my friend Megan's birthday party.

speaker: Martin
text: Fras?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please let that be Megan needing a clown for her party!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_answering phone:_] Hello?  Oh, Clive!  Yes, it has been a long time, hasn't it?  Oh, I am sorry, I have dinner plans tonight.  Well, maybe just a drink then.  Say, 6:30?  Me too. Bye. [_phone down:_] Oh, hell!

speaker: Niles
text: So who is this Clive?

speaker: Frasier
text: An ex-boyfriend?

speaker: Daphne
text: Worse!  Ex-fiance.

speaker: Niles
text: You were engaged?

speaker: Daphne
text: For years!  We were mad for each other.  He was very sweet and had the most gorgeous eyes you ever saw!

speaker: Niles
text: But-?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh yes, that too!  I just couldn't see a future with him. I mean, the man was a total layabout.  No ambition, no drive! He couldn't hold a job.  All he wanted to do was tinker about with his car.  His fingers were always black from the motor oil.

speaker: Niles
text: What a brutish habit!  If God intended for me to work on my Mercedes, he wouldn't have given me Horst.

speaker: Daphne
text: I had to break it off!  But I had to bring him down easily, so I said if we were still free in five years, we could try again!  And here he is, right on schedule! [_Niles re-enters:_] Well, what do I say to him?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, be honest, tell him what you feel.

speaker: Daphne
text: And break the poor thing's heart all over again!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's the best way to avoid unnecessary anguish.  Case in point: Dad, I do not have plans for next weekend, but I don't intend to spend it with Budweiser and Boilermaker and their liver-damaged friend, Seltzer!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's fine.  There'll be other reunions.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Daphne:_] See?  No evasions, no inconvenient conferences, just simple honesty!

speaker: Martin
text: But I don't suppose Jim'll make it next time.  Says here he just had his third bypass.  But I'll see him this June.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_getting up_] Off to work!

speaker: Martin
text: Unless I go first!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I'll drive you to your stupid reunion!

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks, son.

speaker: Martin
text: I guess I'll leave it a couple of days before telling him about Stinky needing a ride. **NEXT IN THE REPERTORY, "COSI FAN TUSHY"**  _Scene Two - KACL Frasier is doing his slot.  He is in the middle of his conclusion for the day._

speaker: Frasier
text: And in closing, this goes out to Keith, the narcoleptic I spoke to a bit earlier.  I'd be glad to resume when you feel a bit more alert, but in the meantime I suggest you reconsider applying for that air traffic control position.  This is Dr. Frasier Crane, KACL, 780 AM.

speaker: Gil
text: Brilliant show, Frasier.  Chock full of pithy insight.

speaker: Frasier
text: What do you want?

speaker: Gil
text: A favour.  Bonnie Weems, the Auto Lady, just asked me to another one of her wretched dinner parties.  Well, I was planning on saying that you and I have ballet tickets, so do back me up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry, I can't!

speaker: Gil
text: But you've got to.  Have you any idea how vile her food is? The local raccoons have posted warning signs on her trash bin!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you see, she already invited me, and I told her I promised my father I'd drive him to his army reunion at Rattlesnake Ridge.

speaker: Gil
text: Oh, very clever.  Well, I'd use it myself, but I killed my father off to escape her Labour Day clambake.

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, Roz, listen, I'm going to the opera tonight.  You didn't happen to remember to bring my...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, your opera glasses!  I'm so sorry, they completely slipped my mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wouldn't really mind, if you hadn't borrowed them to ogle that bodybuilder that moved in across the street.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, just once or twice.  It's not like I copied his name off his mailbox, so I could look up his number and call him while he was in the shower, so I could watch him cross the room naked to answer the phone in front of the picture window.  That would be wrong.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I want them back.  I refuse to squint through _Pagliacci_ while you're trying to watch _The Magic Flute!_  _He leaves.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Apartment Later, Frasier is playing the piano in his apartment._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_o.s._] Dr. Crane, I need your opinion on this outfit. I wanted something that said "no romantic signals whatsoever." _Daphne enters wearing a long woolly cardigan, which covers up everything._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, short of a cactus corsage, I think you've captured it. You know, Daphne, it's been five years.  It's an awfully long time to carry a torch.  Maybe he just wants to say hello.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I certainly hope so.  The thought of having to reject the poor thing again is more than I can bear.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh dear, it's him.  Anything between my teeth?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Daphne
text: Is there any spinach in the fridge?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just answer the door!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, I was afraid you were Clive!

speaker: Niles
text: [_acting:_] Oh, Clive?  Clive? [_he "realises":_] Oh, Clive. Is that tonight?  Oh, well don't I feel silly bringing over this 1000-piece jigsaw puzzle.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure Daphne doesn't want us horning in on her reunion. We're going to dinner!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, can't we order in?  I've already assembled one kitten and two yarn balls!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes the jigsaw away_] I'm getting my jacket!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, for God's sake, will you give them some privacy? _He exits to the hall, while Niles exits to the kitchen.  Daphne opens the door to Clive - a handsome, athletic, boyishly naive Cockney._

speaker: Clive
text: Hello.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Clive
text: Look at you, you look wonderful.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh!  Go on.

speaker: Clive
text: I mean it.  Very pretty and warm.  So...

speaker: Daphne
text: So...

speaker: Clive
text: Oh my God!  I've got a spot of axle grease on your sweater.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's all right, really.  It's just a ratty old thing. Please, come in. [_he does_] Same old Clive, I see.

speaker: Clive
text: I suppose so.

speaker: Daphne
text: So, what brings you to Seattle?

speaker: Clive
text: [_turns around_] My undying love for you.  Oh, damn! I meant to lead up to that, sorry.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, it's all right.  Just a bit...

speaker: Clive
text: Abrupt.  No "how are you, nice place you have here" - by the way, it is lovely.  Is that the, uh, Space Needle? [_goes to the window_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Clive...

speaker: Clive
text: Super.  Anyway, I remember what you told me five years ago. I thought my feelings might change, five years is a long time. But...

speaker: Daphne
text: Clive...

speaker: Clive
text: Let me finish!  My feelings for you haven't changed.  I think about you every day, every night, and there comes a time in a man's life when he's got to sum up the courage to look at a woman straight in the eye and say...

speaker: Niles
text: [_entering with a bowl:_] Cheese Nips?  I'm sorry, is this a bad moment?

speaker: Clive
text: Well, actually...

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, not at all.  This is my very dear old friend, Clive Roddy.  Clive, I'd like you to meet Dr. Niles Crane... my husband.

speaker: Clive
text: Your husband?!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_putting her arm through Niles's_] Yes, six months next week.

speaker: Clive
text: Well, don't I feel a bit... [_to Niles_] Congratulations, you're a very lucky man.  _Niles gives a giddy little laugh.  END OF ACT ONE (Time: 9:24)  ACT TWO_  **A SWELL OF COUPLES**  _Scene Four - Apartment The situation resumes._

speaker: Clive
text: Six months?  Well, you two are practically newlyweds.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, we're still at that honeymoon stage.  It's sickening, really. [_kisses Niles_]

speaker: Niles
text: Revolting! [_kisses her back_] Positively stomach turning! [_He tries to kiss again but she pulls away_]

speaker: Clive
text: I should be going.

speaker: Niles
text: No!  I mean, we are so enjoying having you here.

speaker: Daphne
text: I did promise you a drink.

speaker: Clive
text: Oh.  Well, I suppose I could stay for a bit.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh! [_to Niles:_] Darling, would you give me a hand in the kitchen, please?

speaker: Niles
text: Certainly, my angel.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, I'm so sorry.  It seemed the kindest way to let him down.  I didn't mean to put you in an awkward position. [_opens fridge and bends over to get something from the bottom shelf_]

speaker: Niles
text: When it comes to you, no position is... [_turns round, coming face to face with her backside_] too awkward.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hello, you must be Clive.

speaker: Clive
text: Yeah, and you are?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dr. Frasier Crane. [_shakes hands_]

speaker: Clive
text: Oh, Niles's brother.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  You met Niles?

speaker: Clive
text: Just now.  Though I used to know his wife quite well.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really, you know his wife?

speaker: Clive
text: She's one of a kind, that one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Isn't she? [_laughs with him_]

speaker: Clive
text: Certainly can light up a room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, usually by leaving it! _He laughs, but Clive looks confused and offended at this.  Niles and Daphne enter the living room, shocked by the disaster that's unraveling._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!

speaker: Daphne
text: Clive!  I see you've met my husband's brother.

speaker: Clive
text: Yes.  I'm not intruding on some family occasion, am I?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_now in Niles's arms again_] Oh, no!  Frasier lives here. I mean, temporarily.  He's�

speaker: Niles
text: Had a spat with his wife... Maris.

speaker: Clive
text: Sorry to hear that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, me too.  You know, Daphne, I'm parched, could you show me again where we keep the wine?

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course.  Could you spare me a minute? [_begins to leave_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh, oh, oh! [_stops her_] Wait, you have to pay the love toll. [_she kisses him_] Too much, here's the change. [_kisses her back_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Clive, giddy_] Can you stay for dinner?

speaker: Frasier
text: I told you to be honest!  But would you listen?  No! Now instead you subject us to this ridiculous charade.

speaker: Daphne
text: Play along, please.  I swear, one drink and he's out the door.

speaker: Niles
text: [_entering:_] He's staying for dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, how did that happen?

speaker: Niles
text: He just sort of invited himself.  Pretty damn cheeky if you ask me. [_Frasier gives him a look of disbelief_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, dear God!

speaker: Niles
text: Obviously he still has hopes of winning you back.  We must keep these signs of affection as realistic as possible.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_interrupting:_] Psst!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, what will I serve?  Do we still have that lasagna?

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, you don't expect me to endure an entire evening of this nonsense!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_searching the fridge_] Just do this for me.  And anything you want, name it.  Anything, it's yours.

speaker: Frasier
text: _Any_ thing?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_realizing, turns around_] Except Rattlesnake Ridge!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shrugs and calls_] Oh, Clive!

speaker: Clive
text: [_o.s._] Yes?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_whispering_] All right, I'll take him!

speaker: Frasier
text: Lasagna all right for dinner?

speaker: Clive
text: Super.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm warning you, one thing goes wrong and the whole deal's off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing can go wrong.  We just have to stick to our stories and avoid any complications.

speaker: Martin
text: [_o.s._] Oh, I see we've got company!  _Frasier and Daphne look at each other, horrified.  They rush out to greet him._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!

speaker: Daphne
text: Dad!

speaker: Daphne
text: Clive, I'd like you to meet my new husband's father.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes him coat:_] Or, as we sometimes say in this country, Father-in-law.

speaker: Clive
text: I'm Clive Roddy. [_shakes him hand._]

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, Marty Crane.  Somebody tell me...

speaker: Niles
text: [_interrupting:_] Oh Daphne, we've been so remiss.  We haven't given Clive the tour.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh yes, quite right!  This is the living room.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I think he'll be more interested in the master bathroom. [_covering up:_] The shower being so large and Manchester being so rainy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Right this way. [_she leads him off to the bathroom._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you forgot to pay the toll.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Never mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Martin_] Now go away!

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell for?  What's going on here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Clive is Daphne's old boyfriend; she's trying to let him down easily, by pretending to be married to Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: So this is _my_ place.  Frasier is staying here temporarily, because he's separated from Maris.

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Frasier_] You couldn't stand her either, huh?

speaker: Niles
text: That's very amusing.

speaker: Martin
text: Do I still live here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course you do, but I think for this evening it would be best if you just excused yourself.  You see, it involves quick thinking and improvisational skills, and a knack for remembering details.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I never used any of those skills as an undercover cop.

speaker: Niles
text: Please don't be offended-

speaker: Martin
text: [_sits down_] No, I'm not offended, my two sons have just said I've got oatmeal for brains.

speaker: Clive
text: So, Daphne tells me that you two are both psychiatrists.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Clive
text: Fascinating.  Are you a psychiatrist as well, Marty?

speaker: Martin
text: Me?  No, I'm retired.

speaker: Clive
text: What did you do?

speaker: Martin
text: [_looking evily at the Crane boys_] I was an astronaut. _This causes Niles and Daphne to nearly faint onto the couch. Frasier turns round in sudden disbelief._

speaker: Clive
text: Really!  And you actually flew space missions?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, a couple.  Me and Neil Armstrong, Buzz Aldrin - you know, it was me that gave him his nickname "Buzz,"  You know, most people think it's 'cause he flew fast.  Not true!  He was scared of bees.  _The doorbell rings.  This has to be the most hilarious part of the episode.  There is no dialogue, just a silence of disbelief.  We just know who it's going to be._

speaker: Frasier
text: Wh-Who is it?

speaker: Roz
text: [_o.s._] Open up, Frasier, it's me.

speaker: Martin
text: What do you know, it's Maris!  _Niles and Daphne turn on Martin with faces of mixed fury and panic. He just smiles at them.  Frasier slowly opens the door._

speaker: Roz
text: [_with opera glasses in hand:_] Here are your stupid opera glasses.  Are we friends again?

speaker: Frasier
text: Darling!  _He throws his arms around Roz and and kisses her cheek. She looks bewildered._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispering in her ear_] You're Maris!

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whispering in her other ear_] We're married!

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just play along!

speaker: Clive
text: Well, their little tiff's over.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maris Crane, this is Mr. Clive Roddy.

speaker: Clive
text: It's a pleasure!

speaker: Roz
text: [_overcome by Clive; saucily:_] It certainly is.  So, how long will you be in Seattle?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, Cupcake? [_taking her away_] Well, if you'll excuse me, we could do with a moment alone.  Come with me, darling.

speaker: Niles
text: So, now you've met the whole Crane clan!

speaker: Clive
text: Although, Daphne, I noticed in the phone book your surname still is Moon.

speaker: Niles
text: That must be an old book.  Now she hyphenates; it's Moon- Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: I remember the first time I ever drove a moon crane. I nearly rolled it into the Sea of Tranquillity.  _Niles and Daphne sit down on the couch next to Clive.  Niles places his hand on her knee._

speaker: Niles
text: So Clive, what do you do?

speaker: Daphne
text: Still mucking about with cars, I see. [_points to some axle grease on his hand_]

speaker: Clive
text: Oh, my hands?  No, I helped a man change his tires on the way over here.  Don't have enough time as I used to, what with my business and all.

speaker: Daphne
text: Your business?

speaker: Clive
text: Well, after you left I remembered the advice you gave me, and it all made sense.

speaker: Daphne
text: What advice?

speaker: Clive
text: Well, you know, "get a job you lazy git," that sort of thing. So I took a few business courses and opened up a little sporting goods shop.  Next thing you know I had three of them.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Niles:_] Well, isn't this ironic! [_removes Niles's hand_] All these years I've nagged him to make something of himself. [_forcefully, "Stop the Act!!!"_] And now look at him, a captain of industry, and still as handsome as ever.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, send in the clowns!

speaker: Niles
text: Don't bother, they're here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, bad news, it seems my Maris has to run off, she's got a previous engagement.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, forget about your engagement, Maris.  Stay for dinner!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually...

speaker: Roz
text: [_broad smile:_] I'd love to.

speaker: Clive
text: Lovely, we can celebrate you two being reconciled.

speaker: Roz
text: That is still tentative, it could go either way.  _Daphne looks appalled at Roz, as if to say "leave off!" Eddie runs in and jumps onto a chair._

speaker: Clive
text: Hello there, what's his name?  _Daphne, Niles, Frasier, Roz and Martin look at each other blankly for a moment._

speaker: All
text: EDDIE! _FADE TO:  Scene Five - Apartment We resume after dinner.  Martin is telling one of his wonderful space stories from his bank of fairy tales._

speaker: Martin
text: So there I was, floating 20 feet up in the chamber, when some idiot turns off the weightless button and down I come on this big pickaxe we used for moon rocks! _Frasier, Niles and Daphne all despair at how thick he's laying it on, but Clive is completely taken in._

speaker: Clive
text: And you still walk with a cane.

speaker: Martin
text: Que Sera Sera.  I better turn in, boys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't forget your warm glass of Tang.

speaker: Clive
text: It was an honour meeting you, Commander.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I had fun too.  Goodnight, all!

speaker: All
text: Goodnight.

speaker: Clive
text: Delicious meal, Daphne. [_Frasier and Niles go to the kitchen_] Can't remember the last time I ate so much.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, that explains your fantastic physique.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, you are looking wonderfully firm. [_feels his six-pack_] Yes, and that little tummy.

speaker: Roz
text: Do you work out?

speaker: Clive
text: When I can.  Actually, my shops keep me pretty busy.

speaker: Niles
text: [_enters taking plates:_] Daphne and I have our own little excercise regimen.  We work up quite a sweat, don't we, darling? [_leaves_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't get over it, it's like you're a whole different person. [_aimed in Niles's direction:_] A WHOLE DIFFERENT PERSON!!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_peering out of kitchen with coffee jug:_] Well, who's for coffee?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll give you a hand.  _Daphne enters the kitchen in her fleet of madness.  Frasier turns round ready for a tough journey._

speaker: Daphne
text: Would you please tell Roz to stop flirting!  Has she forgotten she is a married woman?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you're one to talk.  If you batted your eyelashes any harder, you'd blow out the candles!

speaker: Daphne
text: You get rid of her now, or it's Rattlesnake Ridge for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: You wouldn't!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, wouldn't I?  And by the way, Stinky needs a ride. [_Frasier gasps_]  _Daphne and Frasier go back into the dining area. Roz is reading Clive's palm, until Frasier intervenes._

speaker: Roz
text: And according to your love lines, what a naughty little...

speaker: Frasier
text: Maris, I don't know about you, but I'm exhausted!

speaker: Roz
text: See you at home.  More wine, please.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, are you sure that's wise, dear?  Remember that blackout you had last month? [_laughs_] What am I saying?  Of course you don't.

speaker: Niles
text: That's what I love about her, her sense of humour.  Cookie, darling?

speaker: Daphne
text: No thank you, [_to Roz's face:_] some of us do look after our weight!

speaker: Roz
text: Now, now, Daphne.  You have to keep your strength up.  You are eating for two.

speaker: Clive
text: You're having a baby?!  When you were planning on springing that news?

speaker: Daphne
text: We don't like to bring that up.  It's a sore point around here, what with my sister-in-law being barren and all.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, now, it's not her fault.  You see, my brother is impotent.

speaker: Clive
text: ...Congratulations.  Is there a loo I could, er...

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, yes, right there by the front door.  We call it "Frasier's Bathroom," that is why we've monogrammed all the towels with his initials.

speaker: Frasier
text: Have you all taken leave of your senses?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, she started it, hanging all over him.

speaker: Roz
text: What is your problem?  Frasier says the only reason we're doing this is because you wanted to give him the brush-off.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I changed my mind!  Didn't you see my signals?

speaker: Roz
text: Gee, I missed them, it must have been in the middle of one of my BLACKOUTS!

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, wait, wait, there's no need to fight, I'll flip a coin. [_does, quickly_] Oh, good news, Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Hooray!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Niles_] Oh, sod off! _Unnoticed by anyone, Clive exits the powder room and hears the following:_

speaker: Daphne
text: You'd think with all your dozens and dozens of men, you could at least leave one for me.

speaker: Roz
text: Dozens? [_to Frasier:_] Did you tell her that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, forgive me for keeping track!

speaker: Niles
text: Why are you fighting over that man anyway?  He's got all the charm of a cricket bat!

speaker: Roz
text: You're right.  You know what, Daphne?  You can have him. You can have him, he's yours!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, fat chance I've got, now that you've told him I'm pregnant!  How am I supposed to get rid of this bloody baby?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, coffee?

speaker: Clive
text: No, thank you.  I really should be going.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, please, I know what you must think, but we're not what we seem.

speaker: Clive
text: You certainly aren't.  Look, I know I'm a guest here, so I've kept silent so far.  But I'm sorry, I must speak: you're the most appalling family I've ever met. [_to Frasier:_] You breaking up with your wife over a pair of opera glasses. [_to Niles:_] And you looking down your nose at me the entire time you were showing off your "posh flat."  Well, to be honest, mate, I don't think there's anything remotely special about your bathrooms. [_Frasier is offended; to the girls:_] And you two women, flirting shamelessly with me right in front of your husbands. [_to Roz:_] You having just reconciled with Frasier, [_to Daphne:_] and you carrying Niles's baby. Well, I pity your child, Daphne.  And I pity any good Manchester girl that comes here to this vile coffee- swilling Sodom and lets it change her like it's changed you.

speaker: Daphne
text: But I haven't changed!  Really, we're not the awful people you think we are.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, the truth is we've been lying to you all night!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes!

speaker: Clive
text: Well, I don't care to be lied to anymore.  Goodbye, Daphne, Maris, Dr. Crane, Dr. Crane.  I'll never understand how two men like you could be spawned from that sweet, courageous old astronaut.  _He leaves.  END OF ACT TWO (Time: 21:11)_
